skill.name: clinicaltrials-database
skill.description: Query ClinicalTrials.gov via API v2. Search trials by condition, drug, location, status, or phase. Retrieve trial details by NCT ID, export data, for clinical research and patient matching.
skill.summary: Query ClinicalTrials.gov via API v2. Search trials by condition, drug, location, status, or phase. R...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 249 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner misinterpreted markdown documentation syntax as executable code with security implications. The actual skill code (scripts/query_clinicaltrials.py) makes only legitimate HTTP GET requests to the ClinicalTrials.gov public API. No command execution, file operations, cryptographic operations, or suspicious network activity exists in the executable code. The skill is a simple data lookup tool for clinical research.

content.value_statement: Finding relevant clinical trials requires searching a large registry database. This skill provides a Python interface to query ClinicalTrials.gov API v2 to search trials by condition, drug, location, or sponsor and retrieve detailed study information.
actual_capabilities: Search clinical trials by condition, disease, or diagnosis
Find trials testing specific drugs or interventions
Filter trials by location, status, phase, or sponsor
Retrieve detailed trial information including eligibility criteria
Export trial data to CSV format for analysis
Automatically paginate through large result sets
limitations: No authentication - public API only with rate limit of 50 requests per minute
Cannot modify or submit clinical trial data
No access to private or unpublished trial information
Real-time data depends on ClinicalTrials.gov update schedules

use_cases.title: Analyze trial landscapes
use_cases.description: Search for trials by condition to understand research trends, funding sources, and study designs.

use_cases.title: Find patient options
use_cases.description: Locate recruiting trials for patients based on diagnosis, location, and eligibility requirements.

use_cases.title: Track drug development
use_cases.description: Monitor trials for specific drugs or interventions across phases and sponsors.

prompt_templates.title: Basic search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find clinical trials for [condition] that are currently recruiting participants.

prompt_templates.title: Filtered search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for [intervention] trials in [location] that are in Phase 2 or Phase 3.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Get detailed information about trial NCT[ID] including eligibility criteria and contact information.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk export
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all [condition] trials sponsored by [organization] and export the results to CSV.

output_examples.input: Find breast cancer trials recruiting in California
output: Found 47 recruiting breast cancer trials in California
NCT04852770: Phase 3 Study of Pembrolizumab - Los Angeles, CA
NCT05123482: Phase 2 Immunotherapy Trial - San Francisco, CA
NCT04911071: Targeted Therapy Study - San Diego, CA

output_examples.input: Show me Phase 3 immunotherapy trials for lung cancer
output: Found 23 Phase 3 immunotherapy trials for lung cancer
Key sponsors: National Cancer Institute, Pfizer, Bristol-Myers Squibb

best_practices: Respect the API rate limit of 50 requests per minute by using max page size (1000) for bulk queries.
Always check for missing data using .get() methods since not all trials have complete information.
Implement retry logic with exponential backoff to handle rate limit (429) errors gracefully.
anti_patterns: Making sequential single requests instead of using pagination with maximum page size.
Assuming all trials have results - check the 'hasResults' field before accessing results sections.
Ignoring the study status when searching - filter for RECRUITING to find actively enrolling trials.

faq.question: Do I need an API key to use this skill?
faq.answer: No. ClinicalTrials.gov provides free public access to their API without authentication.

faq.question: How many requests can I make per minute?
faq.answer: The API allows approximately 50 requests per minute per IP address. Use pagination to minimize requests.

faq.question: Can I search for trials by NCT ID?
faq.answer: Yes. Use get_study_details with the NCT ID (e.g., NCT04852770) to retrieve full trial information.

faq.question: What trial statuses can I filter by?
faq.answer: Valid statuses include RECRUITING, NOT_YET_RECRUITING, ACTIVE_NOT_RECRUITING, COMPLETED, TERMINATED, SUSPENDED, and WITHDRAWN.

faq.question: Can I export data to CSV format?
faq.answer: Yes. Set format='csv' in search_studies to receive CSV output which can be saved to a file.

faq.question: What information is included in trial details?
faq.answer: Full details include identification, status, sponsor, description, conditions, design, interventions, outcomes, eligibility, and contacts.
